bibliographic-data.invention-title: Financial institution-based transaction processing system and approach

abstract.p: Transaction processing for financial institution-based transactions is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction processing approach involves the processing of financial aspects of a transaction between buying and selling parties using transaction rules associated with a sponsoring financial institution. Transaction-related information is processed as a function of business rules associated with the sponsoring financial institution to facilitate payment for the transaction and the assessment of fees associated with the transaction processing.

abstract.p: Abstract Transaction processing for distributor-based transactions is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management approach involves the processing of aspects of a transaction between contracting parties using transaction rules associated with an administrator and at least one distributor sponsoring the transaction. In some applications, the administrator finances the transaction. Fees are assessed as a function of the transaction processing on behalf of the administrator and, in some instances, the distributor.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Sistema de transação de embarque e uma disposição para o mesmo

abstract.p: "SISTEMA DE TRANSAçãO DE EMBARQUE E UMA DISPOSIçãO PARA O MESMO". Sistema de processamento de computação para uma transação de embarque envolvendo um expedidor e um transportador. O sistema é particularmente adequado para eficientemente automatizar o pagamento de uma transação de embarque e para eficientemente proporcionar o acesso às informações relevantes do embarque. O sistema inclui um processador do expedidor que recebe a informação do pedido de venda e auxilia na geração de uma conta de carga para a transação. O expedidor acessa as interfaces de terminal entre o processador do expedidor e uma disposição do processador central para controlar a quantidade, qualidade e o tempo da informação transferida para a disposição do processador central.

A disposição do processador central armazena as informações embarque seletivas e gera relatórios com relação às transações. Um processador do transportador proporciona a prova de liberação da disposição do processador central. O processador central comunica com um ou mais instituições financeiras, de modo que o transportador é pago e o expedidor é pago para a transação relevante.

applicant-name.name: U S BANCORP CARD SERVICES INC [US]

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SHIPMENT TRANSACTION SYSTEM AND AN ARRANGEMENT THEREOF
SYSTEME DE TRANSACTION D'EXPEDITION ET SA CONFIGURATION

abstract.p: A computer processing system for a shipment transaction involving a shipper and a carrier. The system is particularly suited to efficiently automate the payment of a shipment transaction and to efficiently provide access to relevant shipment information. The system includes a shipper processor which receives purchase order information and assists in generating a bill of lading for the transaction. A shipper access terminal interfaces between the shipper processor and a central processor arrangement to control the quantity, quality, and timeliness of information transferred to the central processor arrangement. The central processor arrangement stores selective shipment information and generates reports regarding the transactions. A carrier processor provides proof of delivery to the central processor arrangement. The central processor communicates with one or more financial institutions so that the carrier is paid and shipper billed for the relevant transaction.

FINANCIAL INSTITUTION-BASED TRANSACTION PROCESSING SYSTEM AND APPROACH.
SISTEMA Y PROCEDIMIENTO DE PROCESAMIENTO DE TRANSACCION BASADA EN INSTITUCION FINANCIERA.

abstract.p: Transaction processing for financial institution-based transactions is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction processing approach involves the processing of financial aspects of a transaction between buying and selling parties using transaction rules associated with a sponsoring financial institution. Transaction-related information is processed as a function of business rules associated with the sponsoring financial institution to facilitate payment for the transaction and the assessment of fees associated with the transaction processing.

Se facilita el procesamiento de transaccion para transacciones basadas en institucion financiera. De acuerdo con una modalidad ejemplar de la presente invencion, un procedimiento de procesamiento de transaccion involucra el procesamiento de aspectos financieros de una transaccion entre participantes de compra y de venta utilizando reglas de transaccion asociadas con una institucion financiera de patrocinio. La informacion relacionada con la transaccion se procesa como una funcion de reglas comerciales asociadas con la institucion financiera de patrocinio para facilitar el pago por la transaccion y la evaluacion de tarifas asociadas con el procesamiento de transaccion.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: DISTRIBUTOR-BASED TRANSACTION PROCESSING ARRANGEMENT AND APPROACH.
DISPOSICION Y PROCEDIMIENTO DE PROCESAMIENTO DE TRANSACCION BASADO EN DISTRIBUIDOR.

abstract.p: Transaction management for distributor-based transactions is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management approach involves the processing of transactions on behalf of clients using rules associated with a distributor sponsoring the clients into the transaction. The processing involves the implementation of rules, profiles and/or other stored data to facilitate various transaction functions, such as order acceptance, invoice approval, payment and settlement, and credit extension.

Se facilita la administracion de transaccion para transacciones basadas en distribuidor. De acuerdo con una modalidad ejemplar de la presente invencion, un procedimiento de administracion de transaccion involucra el procesamiento de transacciones a nombre de clientes que utilizan reglas asociadas con un distribuidor (120) que patrocina a los clientes (130) de la transaccion. El procesamiento involucra la implementacion de reglas, perfiles y/u otros datos (112) almacenados para facilitar varias funciones (350) de transaccion, tal como aceptacion de pedido, aprobacion de factura, pago y convenio, y extension de credito.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: TRANSACTION PROCESSING WITH CORE AND DISTRIBUTOR PROCESSOR IMPLEMENTATIONS.
PROCESAMIENTO DE TRANSACCION CON NUCLEO DE IMPLEMENTACIONES DE PROCESADOR DE DISTRIBUIDOR.

abstract.p: Transaction processing for distributor-based transactions is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management approach involves the processing of aspects of a transaction between contracting parties using transaction rules associated with an administrator and at least one distributor sponsoring the transaction. In some applications, the administrator finances the transaction. Fees are assessed as a function of the transaction processing on behalf of the administrator and, in come instances, the distributor.

Se facilita el procesamiento de transaccion para transacciones basadas en distribuidor. De acuerdo con una modalidad ejemplar de la presente invencion, un procedimiento de administracion de transaccion involucra el procesamiento de aspectos de una transaccion entre participantes contratantes utilizando reglas de transaccion asociadas con un administrador y por lo menos un distribuidor que patrocina la transaccion. En algunas aplicaciones, el administrador financia la transaccion. Las tarifas se evaluan como una funcion del procesamiento de transaccion a nombre del administrador, y en algunos casos, del distribuidor.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SHIPMENT TRANSACTION SYSTEM AND AN ARRANGEMENT THEREOF.
SISTEMA DE TRANSACCION DE ENVIO Y UN ARREGLO DEL MISMO.
MULTI-PARTY TRANSACTION PROCESSING SYSTEM AND APPROACH.
SISTEMA Y PROCEDIMIENTO PARA PROCESAMIENTO DE TRANSACCION DE MULTI-PARTES.

abstract.p: Transaction management for processing payment-related aspects of transactions is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management approach involves the automatic processing of payments to multiple parties with payment chains extending through intermediary sellers. In some instances, an intermediary seller contracts with a buyer for goods and/or services, and further contracts with one or more performing sellers (e.g., suppliers) for the provision of the goods and/or services. In these instances, funds designated to the buyer (e.g., from a buyer's account or credit line) are transferred to the performing seller or parties in a manner commensurate with the contract between the intermediary seller and the performing seller or sellers. Additional funds are transferred from the buyer to the intermediary seller commensurate with the contract between the buyer and the intermediary seller, less any amount paid to the performing seller or sellers for a particular transaction.

Se facilita el manejo de transaccion para procesar aspectos relacionados con pagos de transacciones. De acuerdo con una modalidad ejemplar de la presente invencion, un procedimiento de manejo de transacciones involucra el procesamiento automatico de pagos a multiples partes con cadenas de pagos que se extienden a traves de vendedores intermediarios. En algunos casos, un vendedor intermediario realiza un contrato de productos y/o servicios con un comprador, y ademas realiza un contrato con uno o mas vendedores en desempeno (por ejemplo, proveedores) para la provision de los productos y/o servicios. En estos casos, fondos designados al comprador (por ejemplo, de la cuenta o linea de credito de un comprador) se transfieren al vendedor o partes en desempeno en una forma conforme al contrato entre el vendedor intermediario y el vendedor o vendedores en desempeno.

Fondos adicionales se transfieren desde el comprador hasta el vendedor intermediario conforme al contrato entre el comprador y el vendedor intermediario, menos cierta cantidad pagada al vendedor o vendedores en desempeno por una transaccion particular.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: MULTI-SUPPLIER TRANSACTION AND PAYMENT PROGRAMMED PROCESSING SYSTEM AND APPROACH.
SISTEMA Y PROCEDIMIENTO PARA PROCESAMIENTO PROGRAMADO DE TRANSACCION Y PAGO DE MULTI-PROVEEDORES.

abstract.p: In an example embodiment, a computer-based contract-management approach processes transactions involving at least one supplier (i.e., seller or sellers) fulfilling one or more sub-components of the transaction. Each of the suppliers (e.g., as well as other transaction parties) reference the transaction when communicating transaction information such as invoices, regardless of which sub-component of the transaction the seller is involved with. The invoices are associated with the transaction using the transaction referenced in each invoice and each supplier is accordingly paid for its performance of the sub-component of the transaction with which it is involved. From a buyer's perspective, the transaction is processed in accordance with the sub-components associated with the at least one supplier. Per each supplier, the transaction is processed generally two-dimensionally (via buyer and via suppliers), thus generally isolating (where desirable) each supplier from the sub????components of the transaction for which it is not a participant.

En una modalidad ejemplar, un procedimiento de manejo de contratos basado en computadora procesa transacciones que involucran al menos un proveedor (es decir, vendedor o vendedores) que satisfacen uno o mas componentes secundarios de la transaccion. Cada uno de los proveedores (por ejemplo, tal como otras partes de transaccion) hace referencia a la transaccion cuando comunica informacion de transaccion tal como facturas, independientemente de con cual componente secundario de la transaccion se involucra el vendedor. Las facturas se asocian con la transaccion utilizando la transaccion referida en cada factura y por consiguiente se le paga a cada proveedor por su rendimiento del componente secundario de transaccion con el que se involucra. A partir de la perspectiva del comprador, la transaccion es procesada de acuerdo con los componentes secundarios asociados con al menos un proveedor.

Por cada proveedor, la transaccion se procesa generalmente en forma bidimensional (mediante comprador y mediante proveedores), de este modo aislando generalmente (donde es deseable) a cada proveedor de los componentes secundarios de la transaccion para la cual no es un participante.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Shipment transaction system and an arrangement thereof

abstract.p: A computer processing system for a shipment transaction involving a shipper and a carrier. The system is particularly suited to efficiently automate the payment of a shipment transaction and to efficiently provide access to relevant shipment information. The system includes a shipper processor which receives purchase order information and assists in generating a bill of lading for the transaction. A shipper access terminal interfaces between the shipper processor and a central processor arrangement to control the quantity, quality, and timeliness of information transferred to the central processor arrangement. The central processor arrangement stores selective shipment information and generates reports regarding the transactions. A carrier processor provides proof of delivery to the central processor arrangement. The central processor communicates with one or more financial institutions so that the carrier is paid and shipper billed for the relevant transaction.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Shipment transaction system and method

abstract.p: A computer processing system for a shipment transaction involving a shipper and a carrier. The system is particularly suited to efficiently automate the payment of a shipment transaction and to efficiently provide access to relevant shipment information. The system includes a shipper processor which receives purchase order information and assists in generating a bill of lading for the transaction. A shipper access terminal interfaces between the shipper processor and a central processor arrangement to control the quantity, quality, and timeliness of information transferred to the central processor arrangement. The central processor arrangement stores selective shipment information and generates reports regarding the transactions. A carrier processor provides proof of delivery to the central processor arrangement. The central processor communicates with one or more financial institutions so that the carrier is paid and shipper billed for the relevant transaction.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Shipment transaction system and an arrangement thereof

abstract.p: A computer processing system for a shipment transaction involving shippers and carriers. The system is particularly suited to efficiently and automatically audit and effect payment of a shipment transaction and to efficiently provide access to relevant shipment information. According to one example embodiment, the system includes a processor arrangement that monitors shipper credit data and processes shipment transaction information in response to control data from a user identified from a database of shippers and carriers. Validated users of the shippers and carriers are assigned varying communication access levels authorizing transactions, such as payment to carriers. In response, the processor arrangement audits shipment transactions, issues reports on the audits, assists in resolving discrepancies and effect payments.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Transaction validation system for auditing and method

abstract.p: A computer processing system for a shipment transaction involving a shipper and a carrier. The system is particularly suited to efficiently automate the payment of a shipment transaction and to efficiently provide access to relevant shipment information. The system includes a shipper processor which receives purchase order information and assists in generating a bill of lading for the transaction. A shipper access terminal interfaces between the shipper processor and a central processor arrangement to control the quantity, quality, and timeliness of information transferred to the central processor arrangement. The central processor arrangement stores selective shipment information and generates reports regarding the transactions. A carrier processor provides proof of delivery to the central processor arrangement. The central processor communicates with one or more financial institutions so that the carrier is paid and shipper billed for the relevant transaction.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Processing and management of transaction timing characteristics

abstract.p: A transaction management and processing approach involves using timing-related aspects of transaction events to manage and process transaction-type information. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management approach involves using a transaction processor arrangement to track transaction events with or as a function of timing characteristics. In one implementation, the timing between related transaction events for a particular transaction is tracked such that parties to the transaction can identify and monitor the timing. In another implementation, the timing between pickup and delivery events for a shipping transaction is identified and processed for use by parties to the transaction. With these and other approaches, the management, monitoring and processing of transactions is facilitated.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Processing and management of transaction timing characteristics

nplcit.text: JIT systems and external logistics suppliers-Spencer, Michael S. Rogers, Dale S Daugherty, Patricia J.-International Journal o Operations & Productuiin Management, v14n6, pp. 60-74, 1994 (includes Chart appendix References)

abstract.p: A transaction management and processing approach involves using timing-related aspects of transaction events to manage and process transaction-type information. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management approach involves using a transaction processor arrangement to track transaction events with or as a function of timing characteristics. In one implementation, the timing between related transaction events for a particular transaction is tracked such that parties to the transaction can identify and monitor the timing. In another implementation, the timing between pickup and delivery events for a shipping transaction is identified and processed for use by parties to the transaction. With these and other approaches, the management, monitoring and processing of transactions is facilitated.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Automated transaction processing system and approach

abstract.p: Transaction management for contract and contract-related approaches is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management computer is programmed to automatically set contract terms for a transaction based on business rules previously established between parties to a transaction. In one implementation, the transaction management node automatically derives a contract term including a pricing-related term for a transaction between a buyer and seller using contract information therefor. In one instance, previously-agreed-upon price approaches, such as fixed pricing, seller-controlled pricing, quantity-related tiered pricing and pricing management schemes are stored and used by the transaction management node to automatically derive the prices.
With these approaches, pricing disputes that can occur after a transaction has been processed are reduced and/or eliminated.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Automated transaction processing system and approach

abstract.p: Transaction management for contract and contract-related approaches is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management computer is programmed to automatically set contract terms for a transaction based on business rules previously established between parties to a transaction. In one implementation, the transaction management node automatically derives a contract term including a pricing-related term for a transaction between a buyer and seller using contract information therefor. In one instance, previously-agreed-upon price approaches, such as fixed pricing, seller-controlled pricing, quantity-related tiered pricing and pricing management schemes are stored and used by the transaction management node to automatically derive the prices.
With these approaches, pricing disputes that can occur after a transaction has been processed are reduced and/or eliminated.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Automated transaction processing system and approach

abstract.p: Transaction management is facilitated using an approach involving the use of transaction characteristics to authenticate transaction information. According to an example embodiment, a computer processing system is programmed to process a shipment transaction involving a shipper and a carrier. The system is particularly suited to efficiently automate the payment of a shipment transaction and to efficiently provide access to relevant shipment information. The system includes a shipper processor that receives transaction document information such as purchase order information and assists in generating a bill of lading for the transaction. A shipper access terminal interfaces between the shipper processor and a central processor arrangement to control the quantity, quality, and timeliness of information transferred to the central processor arrangement.

The central processor arrangement stores selective transaction information such as shipment information and generates reports regarding the transactions, with each transaction having particular information associated with it (e.g., shipper ID, carrier ID and other information). A carrier processor provides proof of delivery to the central processor arrangement. The central processor communicates with one or more financial institutions so that the carrier is paid and shipper billed for the relevant transaction.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Automated transaction processing system and approach

The system includes a shipper processor that receives transaction document information such as purchase order information and assists in generating a bill of lading for the transaction. A shipper access terminal interfaces between the shipper processor and a central processor arrangement to control the quantity, quality, and timeliness of information transferred to the central processor arrangement.

The central processor arrangement stores selective transaction information such as shipment information and generates reports regarding the transactions, with each transaction having particular information associated with it (e.g., shipper ID, carrier ID and other information). A carrier processor provides proof of delivery to the central processor arrangement. The central processor communicates with one or more financial institutions so that the carrier is paid and shipper billed for the relevant transaction.

The central processor communicates with one or more financial institutions so that the carrier is paid and shipper billed for the relevant transaction.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: AUTOMATED TRANSACTION PROCESSING SYSTEM AND APPROACH

nplcit.text: - U.S. Appl. No. 09/527,717, filed Mar. 17, 2000, Hahn-Carlson

abstract.p: Transaction management is facilitated using an approach involving the use of transaction characteristics to authenticate transaction information. According to an example embodiment, a computer processing system is programmed to process a shipment transaction involving a shipper and a carrier. The system is particularly suited to efficiently automate the payment of a shipment transaction and to efficiently provide access to relevant shipment information. The system includes a shipper processor that receives transaction document information such as purchase order information and assists in generating a bill of lading for the transaction. A shipper access terminal interfaces between the shipper processor and a central processor arrangement to control the quantity, quality, and timeliness of information transferred to the central processor arrangement.

The central processor arrangement stores selective transaction information such as shipment information and generates reports regarding the transactions, with each transaction having particular information associated with it (e.g., shipper ID, carrier ID and other information). A carrier processor provides proof of delivery to the central processor arrangement. The central processor communicates with one or more financial institutions so that the carrier is paid and shipper billed for the relevant transaction.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: AUTOMATED TRANSACTION PROCESSING SYSTEM AND APPROACH

abstract.p: Transaction management for contract and contract-related approaches is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management computer is programmed to automatically set contract terms for a transaction based on business rules previously established between parties to a transaction. In one implementation, the transaction management node automatically derives a contract term including a pricing-related term for a transaction between a buyer and seller using contract information therefor. In one instance, previously-agreed-upon price approaches, such as fixed pricing, seller-controlled pricing, quantity-related tiered pricing and pricing management schemes are stored and used by the transaction management node to automatically derive the prices.
With these approaches, pricing disputes that can occur after a transaction has been processed are reduced and/or eliminated.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: AUTOMATED TRANSACTION PROCESSING SYSTEM AND APPROACH

abstract.p: Transaction management for contract and contract-related approaches is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management computer is programmed to automatically set contract terms for a transaction based on business rules previously established between parties to a transaction. In one implementation, the transaction management node automatically derives a contract term including a pricing-related term for a transaction between a buyer and seller using contract information therefor. In one instance, previously-agreed-upon price approaches, such as fixed pricing, seller-controlled pricing, quantity-related tiered pricing and pricing management schemes are stored and used by the transaction management node to automatically derive the prices.
With these approaches, pricing disputes that can occur after a transaction has been processed are reduced and/or eliminated.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Multi-supplier transaction and payment programmed processing approach with at least one supplier

nplcit.text: Mckeefry ("Seeking microcontrollers desperately", Electronic Buyers News, n 972, pE4+, September 11, 1995)
Mallory "Great Plains Accounting v.7. (Great Plains Software's accounting software) (Product Announcement), Newsbytes, NEW04220018, April 22, 1993, 2 pages"
Russell ("Kitting out is now in (Use of component kits is expanding as distributors develop added-value activities", Electronic Times (Online), n 852, p SXVII, April 1997, 4 pages)

abstract.p: In an example embodiment, a computer-based contract-management approach processes transactions involving at least one supplier (i.e., seller or sellers) fulfilling one or more sub-components of the transaction. Each of the suppliers (e.g., as well as other transaction parties) reference the transaction when communicating transaction information such as invoices, regardless of which sub-component of the transaction the seller is involved with. The invoices are associated with the transaction using the transaction referenced in each invoice and each supplier is accordingly paid for its performance of the sub-component of the transaction with which it is involved. From a buyer's perspective, the transaction is processed in accordance with the sub-components associated with the at least one supplier.

Per each supplier, the transaction is processed generally two-dimensionally (via buyer and via suppliers), thus generally isolating (where desirable) each supplier from the sub-components of the transaction for which it is not a participant.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Multi-supplier transaction and payment programmed processing approach with at least one supplier

abstract.p: A computer processing system for auditing transaction information between vendors and service providers servicing a third party's needs. The system also includes those transactions involving shippers and carriers. The system is particularly suited to efficiently and automatically audit and effect payment of a transaction and to efficiently provide access to relevant transaction and subscription information. According to one example embodiment, the system includes a processor arrangement that helps vendors validate transactions between service providers and third party customers. In some cases the system is able to monitor transactions initiated by the service provider, for the benefit of the customer, committing the vendor to certain actions not readily known by vendor. However, this is acceptable if the service provider uses a service quotation generating system, provided by the vendor, that has pre-determined parameters that vendor is willing to be committed to in order to immediately secure the new subscriber.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Transaction processing with core and distributor processor implementations

nplcit.text: Retailers pay the price for debit card confusion. (1992). Bank Network News, 10(19), 5-5. Retrieved 30 May 2013
Weinstein, M. (1984, May 31). 10 california institutions to form shared ATM network. American Banker. Retrieved 30 May 2013

abstract.p: Transaction processing for distributor-based transactions is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management approach involves the processing of aspects of a transaction between contracting parties using transaction rules associated with an administrator and at least one distributor sponsoring the transaction. In some applications, the administrator finances the transaction. Fees are assessed as a function of the transaction processing on behalf of the administrator and, in come instances, the distributor.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Transaction processing with core and distributor processor implementations

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Financial Institution-Based Transaction Processing System and Approach

abstract.p: Transaction processing for financial institution-based transactions is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction processing approach involves the processing of financial aspects of a transaction between buying and selling parties using transaction rules associated with a sponsoring financial institution. Transaction-related information is processed as a function of business rules associated with the sponsoring financial institution to facilitate payment for the transaction and the assessment of fees associated with the transaction processing.

abstract.p: Transaction processing for distributor-based transactions is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management approach involves the processing of aspects of a transaction between contracting parties using transaction rules associated with an administrator and at least one distributor sponsoring the transaction. In some applications, the administrator finances the transaction. Fees are assessed as a function of the transaction processing on behalf of the administrator and, in come instances, the distributor.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Automated transaction processing system and approach

abstract.p: Transaction management for contract and contract-related approaches is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management computer is programmed to automatically set contract terms for a transaction based on business rules previously established between parties to a transaction. In one implementation, the transaction management node automatically derives a contract term including a pricing-related term for a transaction between a buyer and seller using contract information therefor. In one instance, previously-agreed-upon price approaches, such as fixed pricing, seller-controlled pricing, quantity-related tiered pricing and pricing management schemes are stored and used by the transaction management node to automatically derive the prices. With these approaches, pricing disputes that can occur after a transaction has been processed are reduced and/or eliminated.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Processing and management of transaction timing characteristics

abstract.p: A transaction management and processing approach involves using timing-related aspects of transaction events to manage and process transaction-type information. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management approach involves using a transaction processor arrangement to track transaction events with or as a function of timing characteristics. In one implementation, the timing between related transaction events for a particular transaction is tracked such that parties to the transaction can identify and monitor the timing. In another implementation, the timing between pickup and delivery events for a shipping transaction is identified and processed for use by parties to the transaction. With these and other approaches, the management, monitoring and processing of transactions is facilitated.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Distributor-based transaction processing arrangement and approach

abstract.p: Transaction management for distributor-based transactions is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management approach involves the processing of transactions on behalf of clients using rules associated with a distributor sponsoring the clients into the transaction. The processing involves the implementation of rules, profiles and/or other stored data to facilitate various transaction functions, such as order acceptance, invoice approval, payment and settlement, and credit extension.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Multi-party transaction processing system and approach

abstract.p: Transaction management for processing payment-related aspects of transactions is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management approach involves the automatic processing of payments to multiple parties with payment chains extending through intermediary sellers. In some instances, an intermediary seller contracts with a buyer for goods and/or services, and further contracts with one or more performing sellers (e.g., suppliers) for the provision of the goods and/or services. In these instances, funds designated to the buyer (e.g., from a buyer's account or credit line) are transferred to the performing seller or parties in a manner commensurate with the contract between the intermediary seller and the performing seller or sellers. Additional funds are transferred from the buyer to the intermediary seller commensurate with the contract between the buyer and the intermediary seller, less any amount paid to the performing seller or sellers for a particular transaction.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Multi-supplier transaction and payment programmed processing system and approach

abstract.p: In an example embodiment, a computer-based contract-management approach processes transactions involving at least one supplier (i.e., seller or sellers) fulfilling one or more sub-components of the transaction. Each of the suppliers (e.g., as well as other transaction parties) reference the transaction when communicating transaction information such as invoices, regardless of which sub-component of the transaction the seller is involved with. The invoices are associated with the transaction using the transaction referenced in each invoice and each supplier is accordingly paid for its performance of the sub-component of the transaction with which it is involved. From a buyer's perspective, the transaction is processed in accordance with the sub-components associated with the at least one supplier. Per each supplier, the transaction is processed generally two-dimensionally (via buyer and via suppliers), thus generally isolating (where desirable) each supplier from the sub-components of the transaction for which it is not a participant.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Transaction processing with core and distributor processor implementations

abstract.p: Transaction processing for distributor-based transactions is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management approach involves the processing of aspects of a transaction between contracting parties using transaction rules associated with an administrator and at least one distributor sponsoring the transaction. In some applications, the administrator finances the transaction. Fees are assessed as a function of the transaction processing on behalf of the administrator and, in come instances, the distributor.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: PROCESSING AND MANAGEMENT OF TRANSACTION TIMING CHARACTERISTICS

abstract.p: A transaction management and processing approach involves using timing-related aspects of transaction events to manage and process transaction-type information. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management approach involves using a transaction processor arrangement to track transaction events with or as a function of timing characteristics. In one implementation, the timing between related transaction events for a particular transaction is tracked such that parties to the transaction can identify and monitor the timing. In another implementation, the timing between pickup and delivery events for a shipping transaction is identified and processed for use by parties to the transaction. With these and other approaches, the management, monitoring and processing of transactions is facilitated.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Multi-Supplier Transaction and Payment Programmed Processing System and Approach

abstract.p: In an example embodiment, a computer-based contract-management approach processes transactions involving at least one supplier (i.e., seller or sellers) fulfilling one or more sub-components of the transaction. Each of the suppliers (e.g., as well as other transaction parties) reference the transaction when communicating transaction information such as invoices, regardless of which sub-component of the transaction the seller is involved with. The invoices are associated with the transaction using the transaction referenced in each invoice and each supplier is accordingly paid for its performance of the sub-component of the transaction with which it is involved. From a buyer's perspective, the transaction is processed in accordance with the sub-components associated with the at least one supplier. Per each supplier, the transaction is processed generally two-dimensionally (via buyer and via suppliers), thus generally isolating (where desirable) each supplier from the sub-components of the transaction for which it is not a participant.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SHIPMENT TRANSACTION SYSTEM AND AN ARRANGEMENT THEREOF
SYSTEME DE TRANSACTION D'EXPEDITION ET CONFIGURATION DUDIT SYSTEME

nplcit.text: No Search

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SHIPMENT TRANSACTION SYSTEM AND AN ARRANGEMENT THEREOF
SYSTEME DE TRANSACTION D'EXPEDITION ET CONFIGURATION DUDIT SYSTEME
SHIPMENT TRANSACTION SYSTEM AND AN ARRANGEMENT THEREOF
SYSTEME DE TRANSACTION D'EXPEDITION ET SA CONFIGURATION

abstract.p: A computer processing system for a shipment transaction involving a shipper and a carrier. The system is particularly suited to efficiently automate the payment of a shipment transaction and to efficiently provide access to relevant shipment information. The system includes a shipper processor which receives purchase order information and assists in generating a bill of lading for the transaction. A shipper access terminal interfaces between the shipper processor and a central processor arrangement to control the quantity, quality, and timeliness of information transferred to the central processor arrangement. The central processor arrangement stores selective shipment information and generates reports regarding the transactions. A carrier processor provides proof of delivery to the central processor arrangement. The central processor communicates with one or more financial institutions so that the carrier is paid and shipper billed for the relevant transaction.

L'invention concerne un système de traitement informatique pour une transaction d'expédition mettant en jeu un expéditeur et un transporteur. Ce système convient particulièrement pour automatiser efficacement le règlement d'une transaction d'expédition et pour assurer efficacement l'accès aux informations d'expédition pertinentes. Le système comprend un processeur expéditeur qui reçoit les informations relatives à la commande d'achat et facilite la production d'un connaissement pour la transaction. Un terminal d'accès expéditeur assure l'interface entre le processeur expéditeur et une configuration de processeur central pour contrôler la quantité, la qualité, et la présentation en temps opportun des informations transférées à la configuration de processeur central.

Cette dernière mémorise des informations d'expédition sélectives et produit des états concernant les transactions. Un processeur transporteur fournit la preuve de livraison à la configuration de processeur central. Le processeur central entre en contact avec une ou plusieurs institutions financières afin que le transporteur soit payé et l'expéditeur facturé pour la transaction concernée.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: AUTOMATED TRANSACTION PROCESSING SYSTEM AND APPROACH
SYSTEME ET APPROCHE DE TRAITEMENT DE TRANSACTION AUTOMATISES

abstract.p: Transaction management for contract and contract-related approaches is facilitated. According to an example embodiment of the present invention, a transaction management computer is programmed to automatically set contract terms for a transaction based on business rules previously established between between parties to a transaction. In one implementation, the transaction management node automatically derives a contract term including a pricing-related term for a transaction between a buyer and seller using contract information therefor. In one instance, previously-agreed-upon price approaches, such as fixed pricing, seller-controlled pricing, quantity-related tiered pricing and pricing management schemes are stored and used by the transaction management node to automatically derive the prices.
With these approaches, pricing disputes that can occur after a transaction has been processed are reduced and/or eliminated.

L'invention permet de faciliter la gestion d'une transaction liée à un contrat et à des approches associées à un contrat. Selon un exemple de mode de réalisation de l'invention, un ordinateur de gestion de transactions est programmé pour régler automatiquement les termes d'un contrat de transaction en fonction de règles commerciales établies antérieurement entre les parties d'une transaction. Dans une mise en oeuvre, un noeud de gestion de transaction déduit automatiquement un terme de contrat, notamment un terme associé à l'établissement du prix, qui permet d'effecteur une transaction entre un acheteur et un vendeur à l'aide d'informations de contrat.

Dans un exemple, des approches de prix convenus antérieurement, telles que l'établissement d'un prix fixe, l'établissement d'un prix commandé par le vendeur, l'établissement d'un prix progressif associé à la quantité et des mécanismes de gestion d'établissement de prix, sont stockés et utilisés par le noeud de gestion de transaction afin de déduire automatiquement les prix. Du fait de ces approches, les litiges sur l'établissement des prix pouvant survenir une fois qu'une transaction a été traitée sont réduits et/ou supprimés.

SYSTEME ET APPROCHE DE TRAITEMENT DE TRANSACTION AUTOMATISES
